PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, February 28, 1942, pg. 21, reads: "Country's Dance Lovers Pay Homage To Count Basie During Series of Coronation Dances - Getting off to a tremendous initial drive in Kansas City and moving into a thrilling anti-climax in Wheeling, W. Va., the third annual coronation dances of The Pittsburgh Courier, under the sponsorship of the top dance promoters in the chosen sections, captured the attention of many thousand dance and music lovers.  At each stop Count Basie and his men of syncopation were lauded for their great musical ability and talent which stood them in good stead, winning for them two of the paper's annual band concerts..."
TitMainTitle: Count Basie orchestra performing at Pittsburgh Courier dance, Wheeling, West Virginia
